metadata.title: CVE-2017-12932 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
ext/standard/var_unserializer.re in PHP 7.0.x through 7.0.22 and 7.1.xthrough 7.1.8 is prone to a heap use after free while unserializinguntrusted data, related to improper use of the hash API for key deletion ina situation with an invalid array size. Exploitation of this issue can havean unspecified impact on the integrity of PHP.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12932` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
php7.0 - 7.0.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
